subtasks: Drive the tractor to the field.
Operate the plowing equipment to turn over the soil to a depth of 20-30 cm.
Break up any compacted soil layers.
Level the soil surface after plowing.
Test the soil pH and adjust to the optimal range (6-7) with lime if necessary.
Apply organic fertilizers by mixing decomposed matter into the soil to improve fertility and moisture retention.
Apply chemical fertilizers (Nitrogen, Phosphorus, Potassium) in the correct ratios for different growth stages.
Use appropriate application techniques (e.g., base and top dressing) during key growth phases.
Soak cotton seeds in warm water for 8-10 hours to stimulate germination.
Plant seeds at correct spacing (rows 60-90 cm apart, seeds 20-30 cm apart within rows).
Apply light irrigation immediately after sowing.
Monitor soil moisture levels during early growth stages.
Water cotton plants consistently, being cautious not to create waterlogged conditions.
Use mulch or weedicides to control weeds that compete with cotton for nutrients.
Apply pesticides and biological control measures to manage pests and diseases (e.g., bull worms, sap-sucking insects, root rot).
Practice pruning and pinching to enhance yield and fiber quality by removing old leaves and directing nutrients to bowls.
Prepare the field for harvesting by ensuring plants are mature and prepared for mechanical picking.
Operate a modern cotton harvester equipped with mechanical arms or rotating components.
Ensure gentle handling of cotton bowls to prevent damage during collection.
Use automatic conveyors to clean and compress cotton into bales within the machine.
Transfer compressed bales from the harvester to trucks or containers for transportation.
Wrap bales in protective materials to prevent moisture and contamination during transit.
Load bales onto vehicles for efficient and safe delivery to processing plants.
Clean raw cotton to remove seeds and impurities at processing plants.
Compress and comb cotton fibers to straighten them.
Spool cotton into yarn or fabric fibers using modern spinning machinery.
Weave cotton into fabric using automated weaving machines for various end-uses.
